translated: Now, therefore, the inquiry into Brahman.
From which is the origin etc.
Because of being born from the scriptures.

analyzed: tat tu samanvayāt  īkṣateḥ na a śabdam
translated: But that is by the method of agreement.🔽Not from the word, because of seeing.
If it be said that it is secondary, not so, because of the word 'Self'.

analyzed: tad niṣṭhasya mokṣa upadeśāt  heya tva avacanāt ca
translated: Because of the teaching of liberation for one who is devoted to that.🔽And because of the non-statement of the need to be abandoned.
Because of contradiction with the thesis.
Because of being absorbed in it.
Because of the similarity of the path.
And because of being heard.
The one consisting of bliss, by repetition.

analyzed: vikāra śabdāt na iti ced na prācuryāt
translated: If it be said that it is not so because of the word 'modification', not so, because of abundance.
And because of the designation of its cause.
And it is sung as belonging to the letters of the mantra.
Not the other, because of impossibility.
And because of the designation of difference.
And because of desire, there is no need for inference.

analyzed: asmin asya ca tad yogam śāsti  /
translated: And this teaches its connection with that in this.
Internally, because of the teaching of its attributes.
And because of the designation of difference, it is different.
Space, because of that indication.
For that very reason, the vital air.
And light, because of the mention of the feet.

original: chando 'bhidhānān neti cen na tathā ceto'rpaṇanigadāt tathā hi darśanam / / / /
analyzed: chandaḥ abhidhānāt na iti ced na tathā cetaḥ ūrpaṇa nigadāt tathā hi darśanam
translated: If it be said that it is not so because of the mention of the meter, not so, because of the statement of the fixing of the mind thus, for thus it is seen.

analyzed: bhūta ādi pāda vyapadeśa upapatteḥ ca evam
translated: And thus the designation of the feet as Bhūta and so on is appropriate.

original: upadeśabhedān neti cen nobhayasminn apy avirodhāt / / / /
analyzed: upadeśa bhedāt na iti ced na ubhayasmin api avirodhāt
translated: If it be said that it is not so, on account of the difference of teaching, (we say) not so, because there is no contradiction in both.
The vital air, because of the same reason.

original: na vaktur ātmopadeśād iti ced adhyātmasaṃbandhabhūmā hy asmin / / / /
analyzed: na vaktuḥ ātma upadeśāt iti ced adhyātma saṃbandha bhūmā hi asmin
translated: If it be said that it is not so, on account of the teaching of the Self of the speaker, (we say) not so, because in this (Upaniṣad) the ground of connection with the internal is stated.

analyzed: śāstra dṛṣṭyā tu upadeśaḥ vāmadeva vat
translated: But the teaching is (to be explained) by the light of the scriptures, as in the case of Vāmadeva.

original: jīvamukhyaprāṇaliṅgān neti cen nopāsātraividhyādāśritatvād iha tadyogāt / / / /
analyzed: jīva mukhya prāṇa liṅgāt na iti ced na upāsā traividhyāt āśrita tvāt iha tad yogāt
translated: If it be said that it is not so, on account of the marks of the individual soul and the chief vital air, (we say) not so, because of the threefoldness of meditation, and because of the connection with that here, on account of the dependence (of the individual soul on the highest Self).
Because of the teaching of what is well known everywhere.
And because of the possibility of the qualities intended.
But it is not the embodied Self, on account of the impossibility (of the embodied Self being the object of the Upaniṣad).
And on account of the designation of the object and the agent (in the passage, 'He who knows Brahman becomes Brahman itself').
And on account of the particular word (in the passage, 'The Self which is free from sin, &c.')
And on account of the Smṛti (text).

original: arbhakaustvāt tadvyapadeśāc ca neti cen na nicāyyatvād evaṃ vyomavac ca / / / /
analyzed: arbhakaustvāt tad vyapadeśāt ca na iti ced na nicāyya tvāt evam vyoma vat ca
translated: If it be said that it is not so, on account of the child's body (of Brahman), and on account of the designation (of Brahman as having a body), (we say) not so, because of the ascertainment (of Brahman as the universal Self), and because (Brahman is to be known) as the ether (is to be known).

original: saṃbhogaprāptir iti cen na vaiśeṣyāt / / / /🔽attā carācaragrahaṇāt / / / /
analyzed: saṃbhoga prāptiḥ iti ced na vaiśeṣyāt  attā cara acara grahaṇāt
translated: If it be said that (Brahman) is not so, on account of the attainment of enjoyment, (we say) not so, on account of the difference (of Brahman from the individual soul).

original: prakaraṇāc ca / / / /🔽guhāṃ praviṣṭāv ātmānau hi taddarśanāt / / / /
analyzed: prakaraṇāt ca  guhām praviṣṭau ātmānau hi tad darśanāt
translated: And the Self (is to be known as the universal Self), on account of the mention of the moving and the unmoving (in the passage, 'The Self which is free from sin, &c.')
And on account of the context (in the passage, 'The Self which is free from sin, &c.')
For the two Selfs have entered
And on account of the declaration of place, etc.
And on account of the mention of what is superior to happiness.
And on this very account, He is Brahman.
And on account of the declaration of the goal of one who has studied the Upaniṣads.
And on account of the impossibility of the other on account of the non-establishment.

analyzed: antaryāmi adhidaiva adhiloka ādiṣu tad dharma vyapadeśāt
translated: And in the Adhidaivata and Adhiloka, etc., on account of the declaration of His attributes.

original: na ca smārtam ataddharmābhilāpāc chārīraś ca / / / /
analyzed: na ca smārtam a tad dharma abhilāpāt śārīraḥ ca
translated: And it is not the one mentioned in the Smṛtis, on account of the mention of attributes not belonging to Him, and it is the embodied one.

analyzed: ubhaye pi hi bhedena enam adhīyate   /
translated: For both are studied as different from Him.

analyzed: adṛśya tva ādi guṇakaḥ dharma ukteḥ
translated: And on account of the mention of attributes such as being invisible, etc.

analyzed: viśeṣaṇa bheda vyapadeśābhyām ca na itarau
translated: And on account of the difference of attributes and the declaration of difference, the other two are not.
And on account of the mention of form.
Vaiśvānara is on account of the special common word.
If it is remembered, it would be inference.

original: śabdādibhyo 'ntaḥpratiṣṭhānāc ca neti cen na tathā dṛṣṭyupadeśād asambhavāt puruṣamapi cainam adhīyate / / / /
analyzed: śabda ādibhyaḥ ntar pratiṣṭhānāt ca na iti ced na tathā dṛṣṭi upadeśāt asambhavāt puruṣam api ca enam adhīyate  /
translated: If it is argued that it is not so on account of the mention of the internal abode by means of sound, etc., it is not so, because of the teaching of the vision, on account of the impossibility, and because He is studied as the person.

original: ata eva na devatā bhūtaṃ ca / / / /
analyzed: atas eva na devatā bhūtam ca
translated: For this very reason, He is not the deity or the element.
Jaimini says that there is no contradiction even in the direct mention.
Āśmarathya says that it is on account of the manifestation.
Badari says that it is not so because of the absence of remembrance.

original: saṃpatter iti jaiminis tathā hi darśayati / / / /
analyzed: saṃpatteḥ iti jaiminiḥ tathā hi darśayati
translated: Jaimini says that it is so because of the attainment, as it is shown thus.
And they declare him in this.

analyzed: dyu bhū ādi āyatanam sva śabdāt  /
translated: The abode of heaven, earth, etc. is Brahman, because of its own word.
And because of the declaration that he is to be attained by the liberated.

analyzed: na anumānam a tad śabdāt prāṇabhṛt ca
translated: Inference is not so, because of the word not denoting that, and because of the vital air.
Because of the declaration of difference.
Because of the context.
And because of maintenance and non-eating.
The infinite is Brahman because of the instruction of tranquility and because of the teaching of the Upanishad.
And because of the possibility of the qualities of Brahman.
The imperishable is Brahman because of the support of the end of the sky.
And that is because of the declaration of lordship.
And because of the exclusion of other existences.
And he is declared to be the object of the act of seeing.
The small one is Brahman because of the subsequent passages.

original: gatiśabdābhyāṃ tathā hi dṛṣṭaṃ liṅgaṃ ca / / / /
analyzed: gati śabdābhyām tathā hi dṛṣṭam liṅgam ca
translated: And because of the words going and seeing, and because of the indicative power.

analyzed: dhṛteḥ ca mahimnaḥ sya asmin upalabdheḥ
translated: And because of the support and greatness of this Brahman, which is perceived.
And because of the well-known fact.

analyzed: itara parāmarśāt saḥ iti ced na asaṃbhavāt
translated: If it be said that it is not so because of the reference to another, it is not so because of the impossibility.
If it be said that it is because of the subsequent passage, then he whose form has become manifest.
And the reference is for another purpose.

analyzed: alpa śruteḥ iti ced tat uktam
translated: If it be said that it is because of the smallness of the scripture, that has been answered.
And because of the imitation of that.
Moreover, it is remembered.
It is known only from the word.

analyzed: hṛdi apekṣayā tu manuṣya adhikāra tvāt
translated: But with reference to the heart, because of the eligibility of humans.
Even above that, Bādarāyaṇa, because of the possibility.

analyzed: virodhaḥ karmaṇi iti ced na aneka pratipatteḥ darśanāt  /
translated: If it is argued that there is a contradiction in the rites, it is not so, because of the seen performance by many.

original: śabda iti cen nātaḥ prabhavāt pratyakṣānumānābhyām / / / /
analyzed: śabdaḥ iti ced na atas prabhavāt pratyakṣa anumānābhyām
translated: If it is argued that it is due to the word, it is not so, because of the origin from perception and inference.

analyzed: samāna nāma rūpa tvāt ca avṛttau api avirodhaḥ darśanāt smṛteḥ ca
translated: And because of the same name and form, there is no contradiction even in the repetition, because of seeing and remembering.
Jaimini says that there is no eligibility in Madhu and others because of impossibility.
And because of the existence in the light.
But Bādarāyaṇa says that there is existence, because it exists.

analyzed: śugasya tad anādara śravaṇāt tad ādravaṇāt sūcyate hi
translated: Because of the heard disrespect of Śuka, and because of his running to it, it is indicated.
And because of the attainment of the Kshatriya state.

analyzed: uttaratra caitrarathena liṅgāt  / saṃskāra parāmarśāt tad abhāva abhilāpāt ca
translated: And because of the indication by Caitraratha in the next section.🔽Because of the reference to the consecration, and because of the statement of its absence.
And because of the engagement in the determination of its absence.
Because of the prohibition of hearing, studying and the purpose.
And because of the Smṛti.
Because of the shaking...
Because of the seeing of light...

analyzed: ākāśaḥ ṛtha antara tva ādi vyapadeśāt
translated: Space, because of being mentioned as a different thing...
In the difference between deep sleep and departure...
Because of words like 'lord' and so on...

original: ānumānikam apy ekeṣām iti cen na śarīrarūpakavinyastagṛhīter darśayati ca / / / /
analyzed: ānumānikam api ekeṣām iti ced na śarīra rūpaka vinyasta gṛhīteḥ darśayati ca
translated: If it is argued that for some it is inferred, it is not so, because it is shown that it is grasped as deposited in the form of the body...

Because it depends on that, it is meaningful...
And because of the non-statement of being known...

original: vadatīti cen na prājño hi prakaraṇāt / / / /
analyzed: vadati iti ced na prājñaḥ hi prakaraṇāt
translated: If it is argued that it speaks, it is not so, because the wise one is the subject...

original: trayāṇām eva caivam upanyāsaḥ praśnaś ca / / / /
analyzed: trayāṇām eva ca evam upanyāsaḥ praśnaḥ ca
translated: And the three are mentioned in the same way, and there is a question...
And like the great one...
And like the cup, because there is no distinction...

original: jyotirupakramā tu tathā hy adhīyata eke / / / /
analyzed: jyotiḥ upakramā tu tathā hi adhīyate eke  /
translated: But some begin with light, because they study it thus...

analyzed: kalpanā upadeśāt ca madhu ādi vat avirodhaḥ
translated: And there is no contradiction because of the teaching of imagination, like honey and so on...

analyzed: na saṃkhyā upasaṃgrahāt api jñāna abhāvāt atirekāt ca
translated: Not because of the enumeration, because of the absence of knowledge and the excess...
Or the prāṇa and so on, because of the remainder of the sentence...
Or the light, for some, when there is no food...

analyzed: kāraṇa tvena ca ākāśa ādiṣu yathā vyapadiṣṭa ukteḥ
translated: And because it is mentioned as the cause in the case of space and so on, as stated...
Because of the attraction...
Because it speaks of the world...

analyzed: jīva mukhya prāṇa liṅgāt na iti ced tat vyākhyātam
translated: If it be said that (the individual soul is not the Self) on account of the indications of the individual soul and of the chief vital air, (we say) that has been explained.

original: anyārthaṃ tu jaiminiḥ praśnavyākhyānābhyām api caivam eke / / / /
analyzed: anya artham tu jaiminiḥ praśna vyākhyānābhyām api ca evam eke  /
translated: But Jaimini (holds that the individual soul is the Self) on account of other passages, and also on account of the question and the explanation (in the passage, 'He who knows Brahman becomes Brahman himself'), and so some others.
On account of the connection of the sentences.
Āśmarathya (holds that the individual soul is the Self) on account of the establishment of the proposition (that the individual soul is the Self).
Audūla-Umi (holds that the individual soul is the Self) on account of the fact that it is to depart in that way.

analyzed: avasthiteḥ iti kāśakṛtsnaḥ  prakṛtiḥ ca pratijñā dṛṣṭānta an uparodhāt
translated: Kāśakṛtsna (holds that the individual soul is the Self) on account of the fact that it remains (in the body).🔽And (the individual soul is the Self) on account of the non-contradiction of the proposition and the example (in the passage, 'As a grain of rice or a grain of barley'),

analyzed: abhidhyā upadeśāt ca  sākṣāt ca ubhaya āmnānāt  /
translated: and on account of the teaching of the desire (to know Brahman).🔽And (the individual soul is the Self) on account of the direct mention of both (the individual soul and Brahman).
(The individual soul is the Self) on account of the activity (of the individual soul).
(The individual soul is the Self) on account of the transformation (of the individual soul).🔽And (the individual soul is the Self) on account of the mention of the source (of the individual soul).

original: etena sarve vyākhyātā vyākhyātāḥ / / / /🔽smṛtyanavakāśadoṣaprasaṅga iti cen nānyasmṛtyanavakāśadoṣaprasaṅgāt / / / /
analyzed: etena sarve vyākhyātāḥ vyākhyātāḥ  smṛti anavakāśa doṣa prasaṅgaḥ iti ced na anya smṛti anavakāśa doṣa prasaṅgāt
translated: By this (argument) all (the arguments of the opponent) are explained.🔽If it be said that (the doctrine of the non-eternality of the Vedas) involves the fault of the impossibility of the Smṛti (of Manu, etc.), (we say) not so, because it involves the fault of the impossibility of other Smṛtis (of lost authors).
And (the doctrine of the non-eternality of the Vedas) is also opposed to the perception (of the existence of the Vedas).

original: etena yogaḥ pratyuktaḥ / / / /🔽na vilakṣaṇatvād asya tathātvaṃ ca śabdāt / / / /
analyzed: etena yogaḥ pratyuktaḥ  na vilakṣaṇa tvāt asya tathātvam ca śabdāt
translated: By this (argument) Yoga (the system of Patañjali) is refuted.
(The doctrine of the non-eternality of the Vedas) is not (true) because (the Vedas) are different (from the ordinary human speech), and because that (difference) is declared by the Śruti.

original: dṛśyate tu / / / /🔽asad iti cen na pratiṣedhamātratvāt / / / /
analyzed: dṛśyate tu 🔽asat iti ced na pratiṣedha mātra tvāt
translated: But the
In the same way, the non-manifestation of the effect is unreasonable due to the logical possibility of that.
But not because of the nature of the example.
And because of the fault in one's own position.
And also because of the non-establishment of reasoning.

original: anyathānumeyam iti ced evam apy anirmokṣaprasaṅgaḥ / / / /
analyzed: anyathā anumeyam iti ced evam api anirmokṣa prasaṅgaḥ
translated: If it is argued that it is to be inferred in another way, then there is the undesirable consequence of the impossibility of liberation.

analyzed: etena śiṣṭa a parigrahāḥ api vyākhyātāḥ
translated: By this, the objections of the orthodox are also explained.

analyzed: bhoktṛ āpatteḥ avibhāgaḥ ced syāt loka vat
translated: If it is argued that there is no division because of the attainment of the enjoyer, it would be like in the world.

analyzed: tad ananya tvam ārambhaṇa śabda ādibhyaḥ
translated: The non-difference from that is due to the words beginning with 'ārabhmaṇa'.
And because of the perception in existence.
And because of the existence of another.

original: asadvyapadeśān neti cen na dharmāntareṇa vākyaśeṣādyukteḥ śabdāntarāc ca / / / /
analyzed: asat vyapadeśāt na iti ced na dharma antareṇa vākyaśeṣa ādi ukteḥ śabda antarāt ca
translated: If it is argued that it is not so because of the designation of the non-existent, it is not so because of the statement by another property due to the remainder of the sentence and due to another word.
And like a cloth.
And like the life-breath, etc.

analyzed: itara vyapadeśāt dhita akaraṇa ādi doṣa prasaktiḥ
translated: Due to the designation of another, there is the undesirable consequence of the faults of not performing what is beneficial, etc.
But there is more because of the indication of difference.

analyzed: aśma ādi vat ca tad anupapattiḥ
translated: And like a stone, etc., that is not possible.

original: upasaṃhāradarśanān neti cen na kṣīravad dhi / / / /
analyzed: upasaṃhāra darśanāt na iti ced na kṣīravat hi
translated: If it is argued that it is not so because of the observation of the conclusion, it is not so because of milk, as in the case of milk.
And also like gods, etc., in the world.

analyzed: kṛtsna prasaktiḥ niravayava tva śabda kopaḥ vā
translated: There is the undesirable consequence of the entire being applied or the contradiction of the word of non-division.
But on account of the Veda being based on sound.

analyzed: ātmani ca evam vicitrāḥ ca hi
translated: And in the Self, thus, there are various...
And on account of the faults in one's own doctrine.
And it is endowed with all (attributes), because that is seen.

analyzed: vikaraṇa tvāt na iti ced tat uktam
translated: If it be said that (the world) is not (the effect of Brahman) on account of its being a modification, that has been answered.
(It is not so) on account of having a purpose.
But (the world) is like a sport (of Brahman), as in the case of the world.

original: vaiṣamyanairghṛṇye na sāpekṣatvāt tathā hi darśayati / / / /
analyzed: vaiṣamya nairghṛṇye na sāpekṣa tvāt tathā hi darśayati
translated: (The world) is not (the effect of Brahman) on account of the inequality (of the world) and (Brahman's) want of mercy, because (Brahman) is dependent (on the world). Thus it is shown.

original: na karmāvibhāgād iti cen nānāditvād upapadyate cāpy upalabhyate ca / / / /
analyzed: na karma avibhāgāt iti ced na anādi tvāt upapadyate ca api upalabhyate ca  /
translated: If it be said that (the world) is not (the effect of Brahman) on account of the non-division of action, (we say) no, because (Brahman) is beginningless, and because it is inferred and is also perceived.
And on account of the possibility of all doctrines.

analyzed: racanā anupapatteḥ ca na anumānam pravṛtteḥ ca
translated: And on account of the impossibility of arrangement, inference is not (possible). And on account of activity.

analyzed: payaḥ mbu vat ced tatra api
translated: If it be said that (the world) is like milk and water, (we say) no, even there.
And on account of the non-fixity of difference, and on account of independence.

analyzed: anyatra abhāvāt ca na tṛṇa ādi vat
translated: And on account of the absence (of the world) elsewhere, it is not like grass, etc.

analyzed: puruṣa aśma vat iti ced tathā api
translated: If it be said that (the world) is like a man and a stone, (we say) even so.
And on account of the impossibility of being a part (of Brahman).

analyzed: anyathā anumitau ca jña śakti viyogāt
translated: And on account of the absence of the power of knowledge in the inference of (the world) in another way.

analyzed: abhyupagame pi artha abhāvāt 🔽vipratiṣedhāt ca asamañjasam
translated: And on account of the absence of the object even on acceptance.🔽And on account of the contradiction, it is not proper.

analyzed: mahat dīrgha vat vā hrasva parimaṇḍalābhyām
translated: Or like the great and long in relation to the short and round.

analyzed: ubhayathā api na karma atas tad abhāvaḥ
translated: In both cases, there is no action, therefore its absence.

And because of the existence of eternal entities.

analyzed: rūpa ādimat tvāt ca viparyayaḥ darśanāt
translated: And because of the observation of the opposite due to having form and so on.
And because of the fault in both cases.
And because of non-acceptance, there is complete non-dependence.

original: itaretarapratyayatvād upapannam iti cen na saṅghātabhāvānimittatvāt / / / /
analyzed: itaretara pratyaya tvāt upapannam iti ced na saṅghāta bhāva animitta tvāt

And because of the fault in both cases.
And because of no difference in space.
And because of non-remembrance.

analyzed: vaidharmyāt ca na svapna ādi vat

analyzed: evam ca ātma akārtsnyam  na ca paryāyāt api avirodhaḥ vikāra ādibhyaḥ

analyzed: antya avasthiteḥ ca ubhaya nitya tvāt aviśeṣaḥ
translated: And because of the permanence of the last state, there is no distinction due to the permanence of both.
Because of the impossibility of the lord.
And because of the impossibility of the substratum.

analyzed: vijñāna ādi bhāve vā tad apratiṣedhaḥ
translated: Or if there is the state of consciousness, etc., there is no denial of that.

Because of the impossibility of the secondary, and because of the word.

analyzed: syāt ca ekasya brahma śabda vat
translated: And there would be of one, like the word Brahman.

From the words.

Water...
Earth...🔽On account of the predominance of the word 'he', and on account of the difference of subject-matter.

analyzed: tad abhidhyānāt eva tu tad liṅgāt saḥ
translated: But on account of the declaration of the identity of the two, he is that.

original: viparyayeṇa tu kramo 'ta upapadyate ca / / / /🔽antarā vijñānamanasī krameṇa talliṅgād iti cen nāviśeṣāt / / / /
analyzed: viparyayeṇa tu te upapadyate ca  antarā vijñāna manasī krameṇa tad liṅgāt iti ced na aviśeṣāt
translated: But the order is reversed, because it is so in the text, and because it is thus intelligible.🔽If it be said that the order is in accordance with the order of the organs, no, on account of the absence of any difference.

original: carācaravyapāśrayas tu syāt tadvyapadeśo bhāktas tadbhāvabhāvitvāt / / / /
analyzed: carācara vyapāśrayaḥ tu syāt tad vyapadeśaḥ bhāktaḥ tad bhāva bhāvi tvāt
translated: But the designation of the Self as the support of the moving and unmoving world is figurative, because it is affected by that.

analyzed: na ātmā śruteḥ nitya tvāt ca tābhyaḥ
translated: The Self is not so on account of the Vedic text, and on account of its eternality.
It is the knower on account of the same text.
On account of the going out, the going, and the non-going of the embodied Self.
And on account of the two latter in the case of the other two.

analyzed: na aṇuḥ a tad śruteḥ iti ced na itara adhikārāt
translated: If it be said that the Self is not atomic on account of the Vedic text, no, on account of the subject-matter being different.
And on account of the text and the inference.
And there is no contradiction, as in the case of sandal paste.

original: avasthitivaiśeṣyād iti cen nābhyupagamād dhṛdi hi / / / /
analyzed: avasthiti vaiśeṣyāt iti ced na abhyupagamāt hṛdi hi
translated: If it be said that the Self is not of the size of the body on account of the difference of condition, no, on account of the admission, because it is in the heart.
Or on account of the quality, as in the case of the world.

analyzed: vyatirekaḥ gandha vat tathā hi darśayati
translated: The difference is like that of smell. So it is shown.
On account of the separate designation.

analyzed: tad guṇa sāra tvāt tu tad vyapadeśaḥ prājña vat
translated: But the designation of the Self as the support of the moving and unmoving world is figurative, because it is the essence of its qualities, as in the case of the wise one.

analyzed: yāvadātmabhāvi tvāt ca na doṣaḥ tad darśanāt
translated: And there is no fault because of the existence of the self, as seen in the case of...

analyzed: puṃstva ādi vat tu asya sataḥ abhivyakti yogāt  /
translated: But in the case of this existent, there is a connection with manifestation, like masculinity, etc.

analyzed: nitya upalabdhi anupalabdhi prasaṅgaḥ nyatara niyamaḥ vā anyathā
translated: Otherwise, there would be the consequence of eternal perception or non-perception, or the restriction to one or the other.
The agent exists because the purpose of the scriptures is fulfilled.

original: upādānād vihāropadeśāc ca / / / /🔽vyapadeśāc ca kriyāyāṃ na cen nirdeśaviparyayaḥ / / / /
analyzed: upādānāt vihāra upadeśāt ca  vyapadeśāt ca kriyāyām na ced nirdeśa viparyayaḥ
translated: Because of appropriation and the teaching of enjoyment.🔽And because of designation in action, if not, there is a reversal of instruction.
Like perception, there is no restriction.
Because of the reversal of power.
And because of the absence of concentration.
And as the carpenter, in both ways.
But from the other, because of the statement of that.

analyzed: kṛta prayatna apekṣaḥ tu vihita pratiṣiddha a vaiyarthya ādibhyaḥ
translated: But depending on the effort made, because of the futility of injunctions and prohibitions, etc.

original: aṃśo nānāvyapadeśād anyathā cāpi dāśakitavāditvam adhīyata eke / / / /
analyzed: aṃśaḥ nānā vyapadeśāt anyathā ca api dāśa kitavādi tvam adhīyate eke
translated: The part is designated differently, and some study even the state of being a servant, etc. in another way.
Because of the statement in the mantra.
It is also remembered.

analyzed: prakāśa ādi vat tu na evam paraḥ
translated: But not so the supreme one, like light, etc.
And they remember.

analyzed: anujñā parihārau deha sambandhāt jyotiḥ ādi vat
translated: Permission and prohibition are due to the connection with the body, like light, etc.
And there is no confusion because of the absence of continuity.
And it is only an appearance.
Because there is no restriction on what has not been seen...
And so in the case of intention and so on...

analyzed: pradeśa bhedāt iti ced na antarbhāvāt
translated: If it be said that it is on account of the difference of place, no (says the siddhāntin); because of the inclusion...
So also the vital airs...

analyzed: gauṇī asaṃbhavāt tad prāk śruteḥ ca
translated: Because the secondary sense is not possible, and because of the text prior to that...
Or because speech is preceded by that...
And because of the specification of seven in the course of motion...

analyzed: hasta ādayaḥ tu sthite taḥ na evam
translated: But the hands and so on are not so, because of the established fact...🔽And the atoms...
And the best...

analyzed: na vā āyu kriye pṛthak upadeśāt
translated: But not the function of air, because of separate teaching...

analyzed: cakṣuḥ ādi vat tu tad saha śiṣṭi ādibhyaḥ
translated: But like the eye, etc., because of the teaching together with that, etc...

original: akaraṇatvāc ca na doṣas tathā hi darśayati / / / /
analyzed: akaraṇa tvāt ca na doṣaḥ tathā hi darśayati
translated: And there is no fault because of the non-instrumentality, as it is shown thus...
The five functions are designated like the mind...
And the atom...

analyzed: jyotiḥ ādi adhiṣṭhānam tu tad āmananāt prāṇavatā śabdāt
translated: But the substratum of light, etc. is the vital air, because of the non-apprehension of that, and because of the word...
And because of the eternality of that...

analyzed: te indriyāṇi tad vyapadeśāt anyatra śreṣṭhāt
translated: Those are the senses, because of the designation of that, except in the case of the best...
Because of the declaration of difference and because of the difference...

analyzed: saṃjñā mūrti kḷptiḥ tu trivṛt kurvataḥ upadeśāt
translated: But the formation of name and form is by the one who makes the three-fold, because of the teaching...

analyzed: māṃsa ādi bhaumam yathāśabdam itarayoḥ ca
translated: The flesh, etc. is of earth, as the word says, and so also of the other two...

analyzed: vaiśeṣyāt tu tad vādaḥ tad vādaḥ
translated: But on account of the difference, there is the doctrine of the two.

analyzed: tad antara pratipattau raṃhati saṃpariṣvaktaḥ praśna nirūpaṇābhyām
translated: In the attainment of that intermediate state, he goes, embraced by the questions and determinations.

analyzed: tri ātmaka tvāt tu bhūyaḥ tvāt
translated: But on account of the threefold nature and the predominance.
And on account of the movement in the prāṇa.

original: agnyādiśruter iti cen na bhāktatvāt / / / /🔽prathame 'śravaṇād iti cen na tā eva hy upapatteḥ / / / /
analyzed: agni ādi śruteḥ iti ced na bhākta tvāt  prathame śravaṇāt iti ced na tāḥ eva hi upapatteḥ  /
translated: If it be said that it is on account of the mention of Agni and so on, it is not so, because it is figurative.🔽If it be said that it is on account of non-hearing in the first, it is not so, because those very (passages) are appropriate.

analyzed: a śruta tvāt iti ced na iṣṭa ādi kāriṇām pratīteḥ
translated: If it be said that it is on account of non-hearing, it is not so, because of the understanding of the performers of sacrifices and so on.

analyzed: bhāktam vā an ātma vid tvāt tathā hi darśayati
translated: Or it is figurative, because of the non-knowledge of the Self; thus it shows.

analyzed: kṛta atyaye dṛṣṭa smṛtibhyām yathetam anevam ca
translated: After the completion of the rites, he is seen to have a remainder by seen and remembered, thus and not thus.

original: caraṇād iti cen na tadupalakṣaṇārtheti kārṣṇājiniḥ / / / /
analyzed: caraṇāt iti ced na tad upalakṣaṇa arthā iti kārṣṇājiniḥ
translated: If it be said that it is on account of the practice, it is not so, because it is for the purpose of indicating that, says Kārṣṇājin.

analyzed: ānarthakyam iti ced na tad apekṣa tvāt
translated: If it be said that it is useless, it is not so, because it depends on that.

analyzed: sukṛta duṣkṛte eva iti tu bādariḥ
translated: But Bādarāyaṇa says that it is only good and bad deeds.

analyzed: aniṣṭa ādi kāriṇām api ca śrutam
translated: And it is heard even for the performers of undesirable acts.

analyzed: saṃyamane tu anubhūya itareṣām ārohau arohau tad gati darśanāt  /
translated: But in Saṃyama, after experiencing, there is ascent and descent for others, because of the seeing of their going there.
And they remember.
Even seven.
There also, there is no contradiction because of its operation.

analyzed: vidyā karmaṇoḥ iti tu prakṛta tvāt
translated: But it is said that the knowledge and action are the subject matter.
But not in the third, because it is so perceived.
And it is remembered in the world.
And because it is seen.
The word third includes what is born of sorrow.
The attainment of its nature is due to reason.
Not very soon, because of the distinction.
In what is controlled by another, like before, because of the statement.

analyzed: aśuddham iti ced na śabdāt  retaḥ sic yogaḥ tha
translated: If it is said that it is impure, it is not so because of the word.🔽The union of semen and ovum is next.
The body from the womb.
The creation at the junction is declared.

original: nirmātāraṃ caike putrādayaś ca / / / /🔽māyāmātraṃ tu kārtsnyenānabhivyaktasvarūpatvāt / / / /
analyzed: nirmātāram ca eke putra ādayaḥ ca  māyā mātram tu kārtsnyena anabhivyakta svarūpa tvāt
translated: And some say the creator, and the son and others.🔽But it is mere illusion, because its nature is not fully manifested.

original: parābhidhyānāt tu tirohitaṃ tato hyasya bandhaviparyayau / / / /
analyzed: para abhidhyānāt tu tirohitam tatas hi asya bandha viparyayau
translated: But it is hidden by the meditation on the supreme, because from that comes its bondage and the opposite of that.

original: sūcakaś ca hi śruterācakṣate ca tadvidaḥ / / / /
analyzed: sūcakaḥ ca hi śruteḥ ācakṣate ca tad vidaḥ
translated: And it is indicated by the scripture, and those who know it declare it.

analyzed: tad abhāvaḥ nāḍīṣu tad śruteḥ ātmani ca
translated: The absence of that is in the arteries, because of the scripture about the Self.
Therefore, the awakening is from that.

analyzed: saḥ eva tu karma anusmṛti śabda vidhibhyaḥ
translated: But it is he only, because of the rites, remembrance, words, and injunctions.
The attainment of half of the delusion is by elimination.

analyzed: na parasya ubhaya liṅgam sarvatra hi
translated: Nor is it both, because of the non-existence of the other, everywhere.

analyzed: bhedāt iti ced na pratyekam a tad vacanāt
translated: If it be said that it is on account of difference, it is not so, because of the non-statement of each.
Moreover, some say thus.

analyzed: a rūpavat eva hi tad pradhāna tvāt
translated: For it is of the nature of that, like the formless.
And like light, because of the non-futility.
And it is said to be that much.

analyzed: darśayati ca atha u api smaryate  /
translated: And it is shown, and also remembered.

analyzed: atas eva ca upamā sūryaka ādi vat
translated: And for this very reason, the simile is like the sun, etc.

original: ambuvadagrahaṇāt tu na tathātvam / / / /🔽vṛddhihrāsabhāktvamantarbhāvādubhayasāmañjasyādevaṃ darśanāc ca / / / /
analyzed: ambu vat agrahaṇāt tu na tathātvam  vṛddhi hrāsa bhāj tvam antarbhāvāt ubhaya sāmañjasyāt evam darśanāt ca
translated: But not so, because of the non-apprehension like water.🔽The state of having increase and decrease is included, because of the compatibility of both, and because of the teaching.

original: prakṛtaitāvattvaṃ hi pratiṣedhati tato bravīti ca bhūyaḥ / / / /
analyzed: prakṛtā etāvat tvam hi pratiṣedhati tatas bravīti ca bhūyas
translated: For it denies the limitedness of the original, and then speaks further.
For that is said to be the unmanifest.
And even in the worship, by perception and inference.

analyzed: prakāśa ādi vat ca a vaiśeṣyam prakāśaḥ ca karmaṇi abhyāsāt
translated: And like light, etc., there is no distinction, and light is from practice in action.

analyzed: atas na antena tathā hi liṅgam
translated: Therefore, by the infinite, for such is the indication.

analyzed: ubhaya vyapadeśāt tu ahi kuṇḍala vat
translated: But on account of the designation of both, like the coils of a snake.
Or like the substratum of light, because of the nature of light.
Or like before.
And on account of the denial.

analyzed: paramatas setu unmāna saṃbandha bheda vyapadeśebhyaḥ
translated: And on the other hand, on account of the mention of the connection with the bridge, the measure, and the difference.
But on account of the general rule.
The meaning of the word is like the foot.
On account of the particular place, like light, etc.
And on account of the possibility.
And on account of the denial of another.

analyzed: anena sarvagata tvam āyāma śabda ādibhyaḥ
translated: By this, the all-pervasiveness on account of the word 'āyāma' etc.
The result is on account of the possibility.
And on account of being heard.
Jaimini's Dharma is just that.
But first, Bādarāyaṇa, on account of the declaration of the reason.

analyzed: sarva vedānta pratyayam codanā ādi aviśeṣāt
translated: And on account of the non-distinction of injunction etc., the Vedānta is of one meaning.

analyzed: bhedāt na iti ced ekasyām api
translated: If it is said that it is not on account of the difference, even in one.

original: svādhyāyasya tathātve hi samācāre 'dhikārāc ca savavac ca tanniyamaḥ / / / /
analyzed: svādhyāyasya tathātve hi samācāre dhikārāt ca sava vat ca tad niyamaḥ  /
translated: For, in the case of the Veda being so, on account of the practice and the right to study, the restriction is like that of the Savana.
And it shows.

analyzed: upasaṃhāraḥ ūrtha abhedāt vidhi śeṣavat samāne ca
translated: The conclusion is on account of the non-difference of meaning, like the remainder of the injunction, and in the same way.

analyzed: anyathātvam śabdāt iti ced na aviśeṣāt
translated: If it is said that it is otherwise on account of the word, it is not so, on account of the non-distinction.

analyzed: na vā prakaraṇa bhedāt parovarīyaḥ tva ādi vat
translated: Or not, on account of the difference of context, like the highest of the high.

original: saṃjñātaś cet tad uktam asti tu tad api / / / /
analyzed: saṃjñātaḥ ced tat uktam asti tu tat api
translated: If it is on account of the name, that has been said, but that also exists.
And on account of the pervasion, it is reasonable.

analyzed: sarva abhedāt anyatra ime  / ānanda ādayaḥ pradhānasya
translated: The other ones are due to the non-difference of all.🔽The bliss etc. belong to the principal.

analyzed: priya śiraḥ tva ādi aprāptiḥ upacaya apacayau hi bhede
translated: The non-attainment of the head being dear etc. is due to increase and decrease in the case of difference.
The others are due to the commonality of meaning.
Due to the absence of purpose for meditation.
And due to the word 'self'.
The apprehension of the self is like the other, due to the subsequent.
If it is argued that it is due to the connection, it may be so due to the determination.

analyzed: kārya ākhyānāt apūrvam  samānaḥ evam ca abhedāt  /
translated: The unseen is due to the mention of the effect.🔽And in the same way, due to non-difference.
In the same way in other cases also, due to the connection.
Or not, due to the difference.
It is shown.

analyzed: saṃbhṛti dyu vyāptī api ca atas
translated: And due to the connection with the collection, light, and pervasion.

analyzed: puruṣa vidyāyām api ca itareṣām an āmnānāt
translated: And in the knowledge of the person, due to the non-mention of the others.

analyzed: hānau tu upāyana śabda śeṣa tvāt kuśā chandaḥ stuti upagāna vat tat uktam  /
translated: But in the case of loss, due to being the remainder of the word 'upaya', like the praise and singing of the Kusha hymns, it is said.

analyzed: sāṃparāye tartavya abhāvāt tathā hi anye  /
translated: In the next world, due to the absence of what is to be crossed, thus others.
According to desire, due to the non-contradiction of both.

analyzed: gateḥ arthavat tvam ubhayathā anyathā hi virodhaḥ
translated: The purposefulness of going is in both ways, otherwise there is contradiction.

analyzed: upapannaḥ tad lakṣaṇa artha upalabdheḥ loka vat
translated: It is established, due to the perception of the purpose of its definition, like in the world.

analyzed: yāvadadhikāram avasthitiḥ ādhikārikāṇām  aniyamaḥ sarveṣām avirodhaḥ śabda anumānābhyām
translated: The continuance of those who are entitled to the office is until the end of their office.🔽There is no restriction for all, and there is no contradiction with the scriptures and inference.

analyzed: akṣara dhiyām tu avarodhaḥ sāmānya tad bhāvābhyām aupasada vat tat uktam  /
translated: But for the syllable-meditators, there is restriction by the general and specific statements, like the Upasads. That has been stated.

original: antarā bhūtagrāmavatsvātmano 'nyathā bhedānupapattir iti cen nopadeśavat / / / /
analyzed: antarā bhūta grāma vat svātmanaḥ nyathā bheda anupapattiḥ iti ced na upadeśa vat
translated: If it is argued that the difference of the Self from the groups of elements is not possible in any other way, it is not so, like the teaching.
The distinction is made, because they are distinguished like the others.
For that alone are truth and so on.

analyzed: kāma ādi itaratra tatra ca āyatana ādibhyaḥ
translated: In the other, it is desire and so on, from the sense-fields and so on.

Therefore, it is in the present, because of that statement.

analyzed: tad nirdhāraṇa aniyamaḥ tad dṛṣṭeḥ pṛthak hi apratibandhaḥ phalam
translated: The restriction of that is not fixed, because of seeing it separately, the result is non-obstruction.
Like the gift, that is stated.

analyzed: liṅga bhūyaḥ tvāt tat hi balīyaḥ tat api
translated: By the abundance of the signs, that is stronger, that too.

analyzed: pūrva vikalpaḥ prakaraṇāt syāt kriyā mānasa vat
translated: The former option is due to the context, like the mental action.
And due to the extension.

analyzed: vidyā eva tu nirdhāraṇāt darśanāt ca
translated: But it is indeed knowledge, because of the restriction and because of the seeing.

analyzed: śruti ādi balīyaḥ tvāt ca na bādhaḥ  /
translated: And there is no contradiction due to the strength of the Vedic text and so on.

analyzed: anubandha ādibhyaḥ prajñā antara pṛthaktva vat dṛṣṭaḥ ca tat uktam
translated: On account of the connection, etc., as in the case of the separate existence of the different cognitions. And this has been stated.

analyzed: na sāmānyāt api upalabdheḥ mṛtyu vat na hi loka āpattiḥ
translated: Not even on account of the general (statement), because it is perceived, like death. There is no attainment of the worlds.

original: pareṇa ca śabdasya tādvidhyaṃ bhūyastvāt tv anubandhaḥ / / / /
analyzed: pareṇa ca śabdasya tādvidhyam bhūyaḥ tvāt tu anubandhaḥ  /
translated: And on account of the word (of the Veda) being of the same nature as the other (Veda), the connection is on account of the majority.
One (soul) on account of the existence in the body.

original: vyatirekastadbhāvabhāvitvānna tūpalabdhivat / / / /🔽aṅgāvabaddhāstu na śākhāsu hi prativedam / / / /
analyzed: vyatirekaḥ tad bhāva bhāvi tvāt na tu upalabdhi vat  aṅga avabaddhā astu na śākhāsu hi prativedam
translated: The difference (of the soul from the body) is on account of its being the cause of the existence of that (body), not like the perception (of the body).🔽But in the branches (of the tree), they are connected with the parts (of the tree), because in each Veda.
Or there is no contradiction, like the Mantras, etc.

analyzed: bhūmnaḥ kratu vat jyāyasvam tathā hi darśayati
translated: Of the all-pervading (soul), like the sacrifice, there is greatness, because it is so shown.
On account of the difference of the word, etc.

original: kāmyāstu yathākāmaṃ samuccīyeranna vā pūrvahetvabhāvāt / / / /🔽aṅgeṣu yathāśrayabhāvaḥ / / / /
analyzed: kāmyāḥ tu yathākāmam samuccīyeran na vā pūrva hetu abhāvāt  aṅgeṣu yathā āśraya bhāvaḥ
translated: But the desirable (acts) may be combined according to desire, or not, on account of the absence of the former cause.🔽In the parts, there is existence according to the substratum.

On account of the combination.
And on account of the non-statement of the commonness of the qualities.
Or not, on account of the non-statement of the simultaneous existence of that (soul and body).
And on account of the perception.

analyzed: puruṣa arthaḥ taḥ śabdāt iti bādarāyaṇaḥ
translated: Therefore, on account of the word, it is the purpose of the soul, according to Badarayana.

analyzed: śeṣa tvāt puruṣa artha vādaḥ yathā anyeṣu iti jaiminiḥ
translated: Jaimini thinks that the statement of human ends is supplementary, like in other cases.

Because of the mention of that.
Because of the commencement of the Anvārambha.
Because of the injunction of one who possesses that.
Because of the rule.

analyzed: adhika upadeśāt tu bādarāyaṇasya evam tad darśanāt

But it is not universal.

Of one who has merely studied.
Not, because there is no distinction.🔽Or it is approval for praise.
And some by one's own will.🔽And the suppression.

original: ūrdhvaretassu ca śabde hi / / / /🔽parāmarśaṃ jaiminiracodanāccāpavadati hi / / / /
analyzed: ūrdhvaretaḥsu ca śabde hi  parāmarśam jaiminiḥ acodanāt ca apavadati hi
translated: And in the case of those whose semen is upward-moving, because of the word.🔽Jaimini says that it is a reference, and it is rejected because of the absence of an injunction.

analyzed: stuti mātram upādānāt iti ced na apūrva tvāt
translated: If it is said that it is mere praise because of the mention, it is not so, because it is new.

analyzed: pāriplava arthāḥ iti ced na viśeṣita tvāt
translated: If it is said that it is for the purpose of wandering, it is not so, because it is specified.

analyzed: atas eva ca agni indhana ādi anapekṣā
translated: And for this very reason, there is no dependence on kindling the fire etc.

analyzed: sarva apekṣā ca yajña ādi śruteḥ aśva vat
translated: And the performance of sacrifices, etc. is required of all, like the horse, etc.

original: śamadamādyupetas syāt tathāpi tu tadvidhes tadaṅgatayā teṣām apy avaśyānuṣṭheyatvāt / / / /
analyzed: śama dama ādi upetaḥ syāt tathā api tu tad vidheḥ tad aṅga tayā teṣām api avaśya anuṣṭheya tvāt  /
translated: But even so, one should be endowed with tranquility, self-control, etc., because those are to be necessarily performed as auxiliaries to that injunction.

analyzed: sarvān na anumatiḥ ca prāṇātyaye tad darśanāt
translated: And there is no prohibition of all (duties) in case of danger to life, because that is seen.
And because there is no contradiction.

analyzed: api smaryate  / śabdaḥ ca a taḥ kāmakāre  /
translated: And it is also remembered.🔽And the word (is used) in the case of not doing what one desires.

analyzed: vihita tvāt ca āśrama karma api  sahakāri tvena ca
translated: And because the duties of the stages of life are enjoined.🔽And because they are auxiliaries.

analyzed: sarvathā api te eva ubhaya liṅgāt
translated: And in every way, they alone, because of the indication of both.
And it shows non-submergence.

analyzed: antarā ca api tu tad dṛṣṭeḥ
translated: And even in between, because that is seen.
And it is also remembered.🔽And there is the favor of the specific.

analyzed: atas tu itarat jyāyaḥ liṅgāt ca  /
translated: But because of the superiority of the other, and because of the indication.

original: tadbhūtasya tu nātadbhāvo jaiminer api niyamāt tadrūpābhāvebhyaḥ / / / /
analyzed: tad bhūtasya tu na a tad bhāvaḥ jaimineḥ api niyamāt tad rūpa abhāvebhyaḥ
translated: But for one who has become that, there is no non-existence of that, even for Jaimini, because of the rule, and because of the absence of that form.

analyzed: na ca ādhikārikam api patana anumānāt tad ayogāt
translated: And even what is authoritative is not so, because of the inference of falling, and because that is not proper.

original: upapūrvam apīty eke bhāvamaśanavat tad uktam / / / /
analyzed: upa pūrvam api iti eke bhāvam aśana vat tat uktam  /
translated: Some say that it is even with the prefix upa, like the state of eating. That has been stated.

analyzed: bahis tu ubhayathā api smṛteḥ ācārāt ca
translated: But outside, in both ways, because of smrti and because of practice.
Ātreya says that the result belongs to the master, because the result is mentioned in the text.

original: ārtvijyam ity auḍulomiḥ tasmai hi parikrīyate / / / /
analyzed: ārtvijyam iti auḍulomiḥ tasmai hi parikrīyate  /
translated: Audulomi says that it is the priestly work, because he is engaged for that purpose.

analyzed: sahakāri antara vidhiḥ pakṣeṇa tṛtīyam tadvataḥ vidhi ādi vat
translated: On the other hand, it is an injunction of an auxiliary act, like the injunction of what possesses that, by the side.
But on account of the completeness, the householder's conclusion.

analyzed: mauna vat itareṣām api upadeśāt  an āviṣkurvan anvayāt
translated: Like silence, on account of the teaching of the others also.🔽Not revealing, on account of the connection.

original: aihikam aprastutapratibandhe taddarśanāt / / / /🔽evaṃ muktiphalāniyamas tadavasthāvadhṛtes tadavasthāvadhṛteḥ / / / /
analyzed: aihikam aprastuta pratibandhe tad darśanāt  evam mukti phala aniyamaḥ tad avasthā avadhṛteḥ tad avasthā avadhṛteḥ
translated: In this world, in the absence of an obstruction to the unseen result, because it is seen.🔽Thus, there is no restriction on the fruit of liberation, because it is seen to be in that state.
Repetition, because of the teaching again and again.
And because of the indication.

analyzed: ātmā iti tu upagacchanti grāhayanti ca
translated: But they accept and teach the Self.
Not in the symbol, for He is not that.
The view of Brahman is superior.

analyzed: āditya ādi matayaḥ ca aṅge upapatteḥ  /
translated: And the meditations on the sun etc. are limbs, because it is reasonable.
Seated, because it is possible.
And because of meditation.
And because of the immobility.

analyzed: smaranti ca  yatra ekāgra tā tatra aviśeṣāt
translated: And they remember.🔽Where there is one-pointedness, there, because there is no distinction.
Up to the end of the journey, for it is seen there also.

analyzed: tad adhigame uttara pūrva aghayoḥ aśleṣa vināśau tad vyapadeśāt
translated: The non-adhesion and destruction of the prior and subsequent sins are due to the declaration of that [knowledge].

analyzed: itarasya api evam asaṃśleṣaḥ pāte tu
translated: For the other also, there is non-adhesion in the same way, but in the case of falling, there is no such declaration.

analyzed: anārabdha kārye eva tu pūrve tad avadheḥ
translated: But the prior [sins] whose effects have not begun are destroyed by the attainment of that [knowledge], because of the statement [to that effect].

analyzed: agnihotra ādi tu tad kāryāya eva tad darśanāt
translated: But the Agnihotra and other [rituals] are for the sake of that [knowledge], because that is seen.

analyzed: atas nya api hi ekeṣām ubhayoḥ  /
translated: For some, there is another [means of destroying sin] besides that,
because it is said that 'it is only by knowledge'.

analyzed: bhogena tu itare kṣapayitvā atha saṃpadyate  /
translated: But the others destroy [their sins] by enjoyment and then attain [liberation].
Because of the statement about speech and mind, and because of the word [in the text].
For this very reason, all [sins] are [destroyed].
That mind is prāṇa, because of the next [verse].

analyzed: saḥ dhī akṣe tad upagama ādibhyaḥ
translated: That [Self] is in the overseer, because of the attainment of that [mind] and other [reasons].
In the elements, because of the declaration of that [Self].
Because it is shown in one [element], not in many.

analyzed: samānā ca asṛti upakramāt amṛta tvam ca an upoṣya
translated: And immortality is the same, because of the beginning of the same course of events, and without dying.
Even then, because of the declaration of the transmigration of the soul.
Because of the subtlety and because of the perception of that [soul] by means of inference.
Not by annihilation, therefore.
And because of the possibility of that [soul], heat.

original: pratiṣedhād iti cen na śārīrāt spaṣṭo hyekeṣām / / / /
analyzed: pratiṣedhāt iti ced na śārīrāt spaṣṭaḥ hi ekeṣām
translated: If it is argued that it is not so because of the prohibition, it is not so, because it is clear to some that [the soul] is different from the embodied [Self].
And it is remembered...
And that is so, because it is said...
It is indivisible, because of the statement...

analyzed: tad oka ugra jvalanam tad prakāśita dvāraḥ vidyā sāmarthyāt tad śeṣa gati anusmṛti yogāt
translated: Then, the burning of the great fire, the door of which is illuminated, by the power of knowledge, by the yoga of remembering the remaining path...
Following the rays...

original: niśi neti cen na sambandhasya yāvaddehabhāvitvād darśayati ca / / / /
analyzed: niśi nā iti ced na sambandhasya yāvaddehabhāvi tvāt darśayati ca
translated: If it is argued that it is not at night, it is not so, because the connection lasts as long as the body, and it is shown...
And therefore, even in the southern solstice...

analyzed: yoginaḥ prati smaryete smārte ca ete
translated: They are remembered for the yogis, and these are remembered...
By the light, etc., because of its fame...
By the wind, from the year, by the general and specific...
Varuna above the lightning, because of the connection...
They are conductors, because of that indication...
Then, by the lightning alone, because of that statement...
The result, because of the possibility of its going, by Badari...
And because of the specification...
But the designation is because of proximity...

analyzed: kārya atyaye tad adhyakṣeṇa saha atas param abhidhānāt
translated: Beyond the end of the effect, with the perception of that, because of the statement after that...
And because of memory...
Beyond that, Jaimini, because of the primacy...
And because of seeing...
And there is no reflection on the effect...

original: apratīkālambanān nayatīti bādarāyaṇa ubhayathā ca doṣāt tatkratuś ca / / / /
analyzed: a pratīka ālambanāt nayati iti bādarāyaṇaḥ ubhayathā ca doṣāt tad kratuḥ ca
translated: Bādarāyaṇa holds that it leads to the unseen object, and also to the seen object, because there is fault in both ways, and because of the declaration of the result.
And it shows a distinction.
And the manifestation of prosperity is by one's own word.
The liberated one is by the declaration of the Veda.
The Self is by the context.
Because it is seen without distinction.
Jaimini holds that it is by the Brahman, because of the introduction, etc.

analyzed: citi tanmātreṇa tad ātmaka tvāt iti auḍulomiḥ
translated: Audulomi holds that it is by the mere intellect, because it is of the nature of that.

original: evam apy upanyāsāt pūrvabhāvād avirodhaṃ bādarāyaṇaḥ / / / /
analyzed: evam api upanyāsāt pūrva bhāvāt avirodham bādarāyaṇaḥ  /
translated: Bādarāyaṇa holds that there is no contradiction because of the prior existence, even thus, by the introduction.
It is by mere resolve, because that is declared in the scripture.

analyzed: atas eva ca an anya adhipatiḥ
translated: And for that very reason, there is no other supreme Lord.
Bādarāyaṇa says that it is non-existence, because it is so.
Jaimini holds that it is existence, because of the option and non-reflection.
Bādarāyaṇa holds that it is of both kinds, like the Dvādaśāha sacrifice, because of this.
In the absence of the body, it is like the twilight, because it is logically possible.
In existence, it is like the waking state.

analyzed: pradīpa vat āveśaḥ tathā hi darśayati
translated: The entry is like a lamp, because it is shown thus.

analyzed: sva apyaya saṃpatyoḥ anyatara apekṣam āviṣkṛtam hi
translated: It is declared to be dependent on either the attainment of sleep or the attainment of union.

analyzed: jagat vyāpāra varjam prakaraṇāt asaṃnihita tvāt ca
translated: On account of the absence of any reference to the world's operations, and on account of the absence of any such reference in the context, . . .

analyzed: pratyakṣa upadeśāt iti ced na ādhikārika maṇḍala stha ukteḥ
translated: If it be said that on account of the direct declaration, . . . ;—no, on account of the statement of the person entitled to the sacrificial session.

original: vikārāvarti ca tathā hi sthitim āha / / / /
analyzed: vikāra āvarti ca tathā hi sthitim āha
translated: And it is so, because it is declared to be so in the case of the modification.
And on account of perception and inference being thus declared.
And on account of the mark of equality of mere enjoyment.
Non-return on the ground of the Vedic text. Non-return on the ground of the Vedic text.
